Trial_Design.evidence: Twenty subjects with biopsy proven pulmonary adenocarcinomas were enrolled in a Phase I clinical trial

Participants.evidence: Twenty subjects with biopsy proven pulmonary adenocarcinomas

Intervention.evidence: to test the safety and feasibility of OTL38, a novel folate receptor-α (FRα) targeted optical contrast agent

Objective.evidence: We hypothesize that folate receptor-targeted intraoperative molecular imagining can be safe and improve localization of pulmonary nodules during resection.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Twenty subjects with biopsy proven pulmonary adenocarcinomas

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of the 20 subjects, three Grade I adverse events were observed

Result_Outcome.evidence: Sixteen of 20 (80%) of subjects had tumors with in situ fluorescence with a mean tumor-to-background fluorescence level of 2.9 (IQR, 2.1 to 4.2).

Harms.evidence: three Grade I adverse events were observed: all transient nausea/abdominal pain
